Term.Name: Proprietary
Term.Definition: For use where proprietary extensions are required, or the use of keywords that do not fit in any classification below
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: STRUCTURED / NON-FICTION
Term.Definition: All programmes dealing with facts, situations, opinions, theories and forecasts
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Bulletin
Term.Definition: Programme with formal desk presentation, usually interspersed with visual material.Example: news bulletin, weather forecast
Term.ChangeComment: Remove spurious 'space' from termID

Term.Name: Magazine
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of separate items which has at least one common quality and presented under one main heading
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Presenter led magazine
Term.Definition: Presenter led programmeconsisting different elements
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Clip led magazine
Term.Definition: Programme dominated or completely consisting of self contained video clips
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Event
Term.Definition: An outside event covered by the broadcaster and with an accompanying commentary and transmitted live or deferred (within 24 hours). Example: Soccer match, theatre relay, parliamentary debate
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Commented event
Term.Definition: An outside event covered by the broadcaster and with an accompanying commentary, and transmitted live or deferred (within 2. hours).
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Uncommented event
Term.Definition: Where the event speaks for itself, i.e. religious service,
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Documentary
Term.Definition: Programme concerning a single theme, involving descriptive and/or interpretative commentaries, illustrations, I/vs, statements, photos etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Discussion / Interview / Debate / Talkshow / Standup
Term.Definition: Mainly verbal programme in which more than one person participates
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Religious Talk
Term.Definition: A programme featuring a religious discussion or debate
Term.ChangeComment: Mapping to DAB

Term.Name: Lecture/Speech/Presentation
Term.Definition: Mainly verbal programme in which only one person participates
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Textual (incl. relayed teletext)
Term.Definition: Programme consisting only of alphanumerical information
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Phone-in
Term.Definition: Programme with content primarily generated by contributions from the general audience either on the telephone or by sending in emails/letters
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DJ with discs
Term.Definition: Programme (usually in audio only) in which a specialist presenter introduces music or other pre-recorded elements
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Docusoap
Term.Definition: A docusoap is a television programme that shows the daily lives of people who work in a place such as a hospital or an airport, and is broadcast at a regular time each week or day.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reality
Term.Definition: Reality TV is a type of television programming which aims to show how ordinary people behave in everyday life, or in situations, often created by the programme makers, which are intended to represent everyday life.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Religious worship service
Term.Definition: Retransmission of religious worship services.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: REPRESENTATION/PLAY/FICTION
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of a prose or verse composition, one telling a story, written for or as if for performance by actors.Examples: soap opera, Shakespeare play, Monthy Python, radio play, Not: documentary or informational programme whose subject is drama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Fictional portrayal of life
Term.Definition: Programme performed by live actors e.g. performed drama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Readings
Term.Definition: Programmes consisting of readings of poems, stories or other literary works
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Dramatic documentary
Term.Definition: Programme performed by actors. About real events e.g. docusoap or docudrama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: CARTOON/ANIMATION/PUPPETRY
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of a dramatic work, constructed frame by frame without resource to live images
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Anime
Term.Definition: Japanese animation style
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Computer
Term.Definition: CGI or 3D representation. Examples: Disney's Antz, Toy STory, etc.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cartoon
Term.Definition: Images drawn frame by frame. Example: Disneys Pinocchio, The Flintstones, Tom and Jerry
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Puppetry
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of a dramatic work, performed with puppet/claymation.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Real time puppetry
Term.Definition: Marrionettes such as Thunderbirds
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Physical model animation
Term.Definition: Claymation such as Gumbi and Poky, Chicken Run, Wallace and Gromit
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: 3D
Term.Definition: 3D animation
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: SHOW / ENTERTAINMENT
Term.Definition: Entertainment is an action, event, or activity that aims to amuse and interest an audience. In television or radio, entertainment is organised as TV or radio shows
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Hosted show
Term.Definition: Programme, that can be regarded neither as non-fiction nor as drama or music/dance in which one or more persons fulfil the role of presenter, host, quiz or games master, announcer, chairperson or speaker and where the rest of the participants are generally members of the public
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Simple game show
Term.Definition: Programme in which the content is primarily contained within the studio and the prizes or rewards (if any) to the participant(s) may be regarded as conservative. Example: University Challenge
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Big game show
Term.Definition: Programme produced on a grand scale in which the prizes or rewards are considered generous Example: Who wants to be a millionaire
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Panel-show
Term.Definition: A programme of a light entertainment nature which is presented by a more or less fixed group of people (panel). A game show is a program where people play a game for points, with the goal of winning money or prizes. Programme, that can be regarded neither as non-fiction nor as drama or concert. Example: The Paul Daniels Show; Der Rudi Carrell Show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Simple game show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Big game show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Non-hosted show
Term.Definition: Programme, that can be regarded neither as non-fiction nor as drama or music/dance in which no one fulfils the role of presenter, host, quiz or games master, announcer, chairperson or speaker
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Standup comedian(s)
Term.Definition: Programme performed by a single, a pair or a group of comedians performing directly towards the audience
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reality Show
Term.Definition: Reality TV is a type of television programming which aims to show how ordinary people behave in everyday life, or in situations, often created by the programme makers, which are intended to represent everyday life.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Observational show
Term.Definition: Where fly on the wall techniques are central to the programme structure
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Controlled show
Term.Definition: Where the flow of the programme is governed - rules based
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Real-life soap
Term.Definition: A soap opera, sometimes called "soap" for short, is an ongoing, episodic work of dramatic fiction (in this case real life) presented in serial format on radio or as television programming.
Term.ChangeComment: corrected termId from 2.4.5.2 to 2.4.5.3

Term.Name: Contest / Competition
Term.Definition: The main purpose of the show is a contest or competition (talent, songs, dabce, etc.)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ARTISTIC PERFORMANCE / MUSIC / BALLET / DANCE / THEATRE
Term.Definition: Music, Ballet, Dance, Mime etc. TV programmes (predominantly) consisting of music, dance or ballet or theatrical performance
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Solo performance
Term.Definition: individual performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word eg Nigel Kennedy solo violin performance
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Small ensemble performance
Term.Definition: Performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word by a small number of people Quartet, small ensemble staged play
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Large ensemble performance
Term.Definition: Performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word by a large number of people Orchestra and choirs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Chorus
Term.Definition: A group of persons who speak or sing in unison a given part or composition in drama or poetry recitation.

Term.Name: Mixed
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Music video
Term.Definition: Short film made specifically to promote the musical recording that forms its soundtrack, and usually visibly featuring the promoted performer(s).

Term.Name: Other
Term.Definition: E.g. mime.

Term.Name: void
Term.Definition: Term not defined
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: INTERACTIVE
Term.Definition: Formats making use of a range of features such as local application support, return path and direct viewer interaction
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: LOCAL INTERACTIVITY
Term.Definition: Formats that happen in the "box" where broadcast "data" is processed locally giving a sense of dynamic choice
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Static informational
Term.Definition: Services (news or entertainment) where the information is fixed and does not update
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Dynamic informational
Term.Definition: Services where the information is dynamic and updates regularly from the broadcast stream
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Viewing chats
Term.Definition: The show displays chats taking place over local and remote systems
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Quiz - Basic multiple choice
Term.Definition: Using any key number, ft, or arrows etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Quiz - Text or number entry answers
Term.Definition: Entering real text or numbers into a format
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Re-ordering
Term.Definition: Competitions based on moving lists into correct orders
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Positional
Term.Definition: Challenges or games such as "Spot the Ball", clicking on quess where something is
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Sync quiz
Term.Definition: Synchronized with audio and/or video (the programme)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Timer quiz
Term.Definition: Quiz synchronized with audio and/or video
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Elimination and timer
Term.Definition: Against the clock
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Categories
Term.Definition: Selecting from batches of questions
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Level based quiz/game
Term.Definition: Cannot move on without completing last level - Difficulty or linear challenge
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Following a sequence
Term.Definition: Temporal, Simon says, red next then green etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Local multi player
Term.Definition: Players using the same box in the same space
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Multi stream audio-video
Term.Definition: Services where the interaction is based mostly around alternate, parallel streamed audio or video access
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Enhanced advertisement
Term.Definition: Local interaction, more information locally etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Logic based games
Term.Definition: Logic games usually simulate some well known logic puzzle like Master Mind or the game where you have put sliding numbered tiles in order inside a box.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Word games
Term.Definition: Games involving the formation, discovery, or alteration of a word or words
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Positional games
Term.Definition: positional games are games described by a finite set of positions in which a move consists of claiming a previously-unclaimed position. Well-known games that fall into this class include Tic-tac-toe, Hex, and the Shannon switching game.[
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Board games
Term.Definition: A board game is a game that involves counters or pieces moved or placed on a pre-marked surface or "board", according to a set of rules.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Text based gaming
Term.Definition: A text game or text-based game is a video game that uses text characters instead of bitmapped or vector graphics.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Dynamic 2D/3D graphics
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: INTERMITTENT RESPONSE
Term.Definition: Formats that require an intermittent or continuous return path
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Single impulse vote
Term.Definition: aka "clap-o-meter" - mass aggregation of single hit "press red now if you think this" type votes
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse vote from choices
Term.Definition: Vote from range of items - favourite act, band etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse Yes/No vote
Term.Definition: Impulse vote from two choices yes/no
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse vote with a value
Term.Definition: Vote for something to happen with a value attached - e.g. how many tins of baked beans should he eat
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Submit answers/form
Term.Definition: Press now to send off answers or details - quiz or competition
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: SMS using mobile
Term.Definition: Sending text from mobile into iTV or web platforms
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: SMS using TV remote
Term.Definition: Entry of messages using TV number/letter keys
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse gambling
Term.Definition: Using intermittent persistently protected connection to place real or fantasy bets
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse transaction
Term.Definition: Using intermittent persistently protected connection to buy product - T or ECommerce
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Multi player TS networked services/games
Term.Definition: Multi point networking in either time-shifted mode
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Interactive advertisement
Term.Definition: Local interaction, request for more info, details even link to impulse transaction etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ALWAYS ON CONNECTION
Term.Definition: Formats that ideally require a continuous connection to be delivered
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Chat Forum
Term.Definition: Using built in platform functionality
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Chat Forum via web
Term.Definition: STB with other infrastructure layer e.g. web chat engine in web browser on top of proprietary api
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Threaded mail discussions
Term.Definition: Listed as discussion threads such as usenet type
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Point to point
Term.Definition: Show enables/includes one to one mailing
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: 3rd party point to point
Term.Definition: Using 3rd party peer to peer (one to one) chat facility layered over the show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Voice chat using mic capability
Term.Definition: Speech to text engine enabling chat/mailing using IP for example
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Dual player networked services/games
Term.Definition: One to one, peer networking
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Multi player RT networked services/games
Term.Definition: Multi point networking in real time
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Gambling services
Term.Definition: Using continuous persistently protected connection
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Impulse transaction
Term.Definition: Using intermittent persistently protected connection to buy product - T or ECommerce
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Non-linear audio-video
Term.Definition: Services where the interaction is based mostly around choosing alternate audio or video files - VOD and AOD, maybe combined with 2.1.1.15 (multi stream)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Unknown
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Other
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
